activity: Scenic Float Trip on the Snake River
reasons: Incredible views of the Tetons from the water
Accessible for all ages and skill levels
Great chance to see bald eagles and moose
No paddling required—just relax and enjoy
Cool way to beat the summer heat
Local guides provide fun educational commentary
Perfect mix of adventure and serenity
Great intro to Jackson’s natural beauty

activity: Horseback Riding in Bridger-Teton National Forest
reasons: Local guides match horses to skill level
Get off the beaten path with little effort
Rides from 1 hour to full-day trips available
Deepens connection with the area’s cowboy roots

activity: Mountain Biking at Snow King or Teton Pass
reasons: Trail options from beginner to advanced
Lift-access biking available at Snow King
Cooler temps at elevation in summer
Bikes and gear available for rent in town
Teton Freedom Riders maintain excellent trails
Popular with both locals and visitors
Bike-friendly town with lots of support

activity: Whitewater Rafting the Snake River Canyon
reasons: Gorgeous canyon scenery and big splash zones
Safe and fun for older kids and adults
Great bonding activity for families or groups
Professional guides make it safe and fun
One of the most popular Jackson adventures
Photos and videos of your trip are available
Just outside of town but quiet and wild
Great chance to see moose and deer
Less crowded than National Park trails
Popular with mountain bikers and hikers
Good elevation gain for a challenge
Ideal for sunrise or sunset hikes

activity: Fly Fishing on the Snake or Gros Ventre Rivers
reasons: Local guides tailor trips to all levels
Wade fishing and drift boat options
Wildlife sightings while fishing are common

activity: Riding the Jackson Hole Aerial Tram (Teton Village)
reasons: Unbeatable views of the Tetons and valley
No hiking required to enjoy the view
Can combine with a short hike or paraglide
Launches from the top of the tram
Can be paired with a tram ride
Stunning bird's-eye views of the Tetons
Safe and thrilling for most ages
Avoids park crowds but sees great animals
Expert guides help spot elusive wildlife
Good chance to see bears, wolves, elk
Kids love the scavenger hunt element
Quick hike or ride to the top
Great way to end the day

activity: Guided Rock Climbing at Snow King or Blacktail Butte
reasons: Learn to climb in a safe environment
Fun and active way to explore Jackson
Ride through the forest to a campfire dinner
Authentic cowboy meal in the mountains
Combine two classic activities in one

activity: Mountain Biking on Cache Creek and Hagen Trails
reasons: Right out of town—no car needed
Bikes can be rented in downtown Jackson
Nice mix of flow and technical riding
Teton Freedom Riders maintain them well
Easy to combine with mini-golf or coaster
Close to town but feels remote
Connects to hiking and biking trails

reservations.notes: Dispersed sites are first-come, first-serve. Developed campgrounds may require reservations via recreation.gov.
